Works great - Here's what you do need to do to clean it.

1) Download / Seed

2) Download a more up-to-date emulator. Vimm and Zophar's Domain are great places that hold these.

3) Open up the archive and copy the contents of "Super Nintendo Roms" to your ROM folder.

4) Open up your DOS prompt (you can just hit the start menu and run "cmd.exe")

5) Direct the command prompt to your ROM directory (for example "cd\Program Files\Snes9x\ROMS\")

6) Rename all files without an extension to .smc ("REN *. *.smc") - Don't forget the space between the *. and the *.smc!

7) Open up your ROM folder and sort by size. Delete anything under 33KB. Files that small are demos or possibly worse. 

8) Search for the directory for anything that includes the words "sex", "porn", or "rape". Feel free to keep them if you wish to try them out and you're into that sort of thing. I personally find it safer to just delete the files and search for sex, porn, and rape on my own time.

9) There will be about 14 files that didn't get changed because they stupidly have periods in their name. (eg: Ms. Pac-Man) Simply rename these manually. 

10) Load the games up in your favorite emulator and enjoy! Almost every common game you can think of is here, though I've found that there are a couple more obscure ones such as "The Magical Quest starring Mickey Mouse" (Awesome game) are missing, but those are again easy to find online. This should be fine to get your collection most of the way there.

On my computer:
AMD Athlon II 260 Dual Core @3.2Ghz each
ATI Radeon 5750 1GB RAM
2 GB RAM
MSI Mainboard
and 1080p res I can run the PS2 emulator at 720p with anti-aliasing and DirectX11 at 60fps constantly and higher is the games not regional. If it's PAL I only get 50 FPS ofcourse.  You don't need a super computer. Just a nice one.  My computer is fast as hell but it's no where near amazing.  At 1080p and DirectX9 I can still maintain 60 fps.  Keep in mind I also used interlacing to make sure the screen didn't shake (a constant problem with PSCX2).  I just had to enable a few hacks and bam, the games ran amazingly.  So if you have specs near mine, you can run PSCX2 just fine and if your computer has better specs then mine then don't even bother asking, it will work.

Thanks man for this.  Wish my mom hadn't thrown my N64 out a couple years ago. I loved playing Paper Mario. :)
